business.headline: Retired before March 2025? Don't miss UPS benefits for you or your spouseIntroduced by the Central Government on April 1, 2025, the UPS provides additional benefits to those who have completed at least 10 years of qualifying service in the Central Government and their legally wedded spouses.

Nation in arrears: Inside Pakistan's never-ending bailout loopWhy does Pakistan keep turning to the IMF for rescue, but never seems to recover? What's trapping its economy in this endless bailout loop? Dive in to find out.

'GDP means little if it hides empty plates': Analyst on India's inequality crisisIndia's economy may be booming, but over half its people still can't afford three meals a day, notes an analyst. In contrast, smaller African economies like Nigeria, Kenya, and Ghana rank higher in tackling hunger.

Borana Weaves lists at 13% premium: Should you hold or book profit?Borana Weaves' listing was slightly below what many in the market had expected. The grey market premium (GMP) had been showing a possible listing gain of 20-22%, with the premium standing at Rs 43-45 before the listing.

'Could take 50 years': Gurugram startup founder on India matching Japan's lifeIndia's economic journey faces significant hurdles as inequality, agricultural dependency, and regional disparities hinder progress towards matching Japan's quality of life.

Volvo to slash 3,000 white-collar jobs in restructuring move: ReportA major portion of the cost-cutting will come from trimming white-collar roles, which account for around 40% of the company's total staff. Globally, the company has about 29,000 employees in Europe, 10,000 in Asia, and 3,000 in the Americas.

Borana Weaves share price: Stock extends gains after listing at 13% premiumWhile the listing price was above the issue price, it was slightly lower than what many expected. In the grey market, the stock had shown a premium of Rs 43-45 ahead of the listing, which suggested possible gains of around 20-22% on debut.

Good news for exporters as key tax refund scheme to return. Details hereThe Remission of Duties and Taxes on Exported Products (RoDTEP) scheme, which reimburses levies not covered by any other government programme, had been on hold since February 5 but will now resume.

IndiGo co-founder sells $1.36 billion of airline's shares: ReportThe shares were sold at 5,230.5 rupees ($61.35) each, the term sheet seen by Reuters showed, representing a discount of 3.5% to the company's closing price on Monday.

Explained: Why Sagility India Ltd shares fell 5% todaySagility India Ltd said it remains confident of steady performance through the next financial year. It expects growth supported by a strong balance sheet, a wide client base, and consistent business execution.

Sensex sinks 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 2:34 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 931.34 points at 81,245.11, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 252 points to 24,749.15. Broader market indices also faced selling pressure, with heightened volatility dragging down sentiment across the board.

Olectra Greentech shares tumble nearly 7% in early trade. Here's whyThe stock, which has delivered over 2,250% returns in the last five years, has lost about a quarter of its value over the past year.

entertainment.headline: Deepika's rumoured exit from Spirit, Vanga's 'billi' jibe - who's really in khundak?Actor Deepika Padukone reportedly exited Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Spirit', leaving the director furious. So much so that he wrote a long note on social media without naming the actor but referring to her as 'billi in khundak', meaning 'an angry cat'.

I like AI, but not sure if AI will like me : Kamal Haasan | ExclusiveIn an exclusive interview with Kamal Haasan, actor Kamal Haasan opened up about artificial intelligence's role in cinema ahead of his new film 'Thug Life'. The movie marks a historic reunion with director Mani Ratnam after nearly four decades.

Woman detained for trespassing at Aditya Roy Kapur's houseA woman was detained for trespassing at Aditya Roy Kapur's residence while he was away. This was not her first such incident. Last week, she reportedly attempted to gain access to superstar Salman Khan's residence.

Mani Ratnam denies film with Naveen Polishetty, Rukmini Vasanth: That's news to meDirector Mani Ratnam, in a recent interview, dismissed rumours of making a light-hearted love story with actors Naveen Polishetty and Rukmini Vasanth.

Sunil Grover introduces multiverse of "Naidu" to Rana Naidu star Rana DaggubatiThe second season of 'Baahubali' star Rana Daggubati's Netflix series, 'Rana Naidu' is scheduled to start streaming on June 13. Ahead of its release, comedian Sunil Grover brought a unique twist to the tale as Shana Naidu.

Kannappa film hard drive goes missing in Hyderabad, 2 suspects abscondA hard drive containing crucial 'Kannappa' film content has gone missing in Hyderabad. The incident raises serious security concerns within the film industry amid the ongoing police investigation.

Thudarum OTT release: Mohanlal, Shobana's crime drama to stream on JioHotstarThudarum OTT release date out: Malayalam crime drama 'Thudarum', starring Mohanlal and Shobana, will stream on JioHotstar from May 30. The film's gripping mystery and drama promise to engage viewers across India.

Hina Khan, Vikrant Massey visit Sri Sri Ravi Shankar's ashram, share picsActor Hina Khan shared Instagram photos featuring Vikrant Massey and Priyanka Chopra's mother, Madhu Chopra. They visited Sri Sri Ravi Shankar's aashram in Bengaluru.

Farah Khan recalls telling children 'sharam aani chahiye' over Rasha's dance videoFilmmaker Farah Khan recently recalled telling her kids to be ashamed of themselves after watching 14-year-old Rasha Thadani dancing like a dream in a video shared by Raveena Tandon. She opened up about it in her vlog with Raveena Tandon.

Ram Kapoor headlines Indian adaptation of Monk. Watch teaserJioHotstar unveils 'Mistry' teaser starring Ram Kapoor as an OCD detective. The series adapts a popular American show, promising a fresh Indian perspective on unsolved mysteries.

Paid trolls can't dim my light: Urvashi blasts Diet Sabya for Cannes staircase jabActor Urvashi Rautela shared a damning note on Instagram, criticising Diet Sabya for 'falsely' claiming that she blocked the staircase at the Cannes Film Festival for her photoshoot. She called the fashion watchdog page a 'paid troll' which targets hardworking outsiders like her.

Unni Mukundan assaulted me, didn't like me praising Tovino's film: Former managerActor Unni Mukundan's former manager, Vipin Kumar, filed a complaint against him for abusing and assaulting him. Speaking to the media, Vipin claimed that the 'Marco' actor didn't like him praising actor Tovino Thomas's 'Narivetta'.

Sonu Sood's shirtless biker moment in Spiti backfires, police probe onA shirtless Sonu Sood is seen riding a bike without a helmet in the Spiti valley. The police commented on the video and announced that a probe was underway.

Salman Khan issues warning about smoking, fake friends with Sohail's new clipActor Salman Khan issued a cautionary warning about smoking and fake friends on Instagram. He shared a clip of his brother Sohail Khan smoking in what appears to be his upcoming project.

Arjun Kapoor mentions 'selfish people' in cryptic note, says it's 'in our DNA'Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a note about 'selfish people' on his Instagram story. He wrote a few lines in his stories and referred to people who don't 'show up' in need.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 4: Impressive 1st Monday for Rajkummar Rao's filmRajkummar Rao's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' has surprisingly performed decently well at the box office despite mixed reviews. The film has now passed its Monday test as well.

Actor Nani calls Tourist Family gem of a film, director says his praise unexpectedTelugu actor Nani appreciated the Tamil film, 'Tourist Family', calling it a 'gem'. 25-year-old director Abishan Jeevinth was over the moon seeing Nani's praise.

'Is this your feminism?' Sandeep Vanga's jab amid row over Deepika's exit from filmFilmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga slammed the 'dirty PR games' of an unnamed actor in a cryptic post on X. It was rumoured that Deepika Padukone was considered to play the female lead in his upcoming film, 'Spirit'. Later, the makers officially announced that Triptii Dimri had been taken on board.

'Duck Dynasty' star Phil Robertson dies at  79Phil Robertson, founder of Duck Commander and star of Duck Dynasty, has died at 79. The family plans a private service and public memorial. His faith and legacy touched millions.

general news.headline: Terrorists should've been dealt with in 1947, Sardar Patel's advice was ignored: PMPrime Minister Narendra Modi said that the first terrorist attack in Kashmir after Partition should have been dealt with decisively in 1947, as today's terrorism is a distorted continuation of that long-standing threat.

Suicide pact? 6 of family found dead in car, 7th says 'will die in 5 minutes'In a video that has surfaced showing the man's final moments, locals can be heard saying, 'Give him some water,' while others are heard calling local authorities to come to the spot immediately. The family took this extreme step as they were in heavy debt and financial distress, according to locals present at the scene.

How vote bank politics kept Pahalgam's Baisaran away from road connectivityThe remote location of Baisaran meadow, accessible only by foot or pony ride via a dirt track, is believed to have played a key role in letting the terrorists carry out the carnage and escape before security forces could arrive.

Sensex sinks 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 2:34 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 931.34 points at 81,245.11, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 252 points to 24,749.15. Broader market indices also faced selling pressure, with heightened volatility dragging down sentiment across the board.

Deepika's rumoured exit from Spirit, Vanga's 'billi' jibe - who's really in khundak?Actor Deepika Padukone reportedly exited Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Spirit', leaving the director furious. So much so that he wrote a long note on social media without naming the actor but referring to her as 'billi in khundak', meaning 'an angry cat'.

India hires Trump's brain for lobbying, Pakistan his ex-bodyguardIn what seems like a clash of brain and brawn, India has tapped Trump's senior adviser, Jason Miller, and a communication strategist, while Pakistan has recruited Keith Schiller, the US President's long-time bodyguard. Schiller has been famous for delivering both resignation letters and punches on behalf of Trump. Here's more.

Woman detained for trespassing at Aditya Roy Kapur's houseA woman was detained for trespassing at Aditya Roy Kapur's residence while he was away. This was not her first such incident. Last week, she reportedly attempted to gain access to superstar Salman Khan's residence.

Ruining her life: Court orders release of student arrested over Op Sindoor postThe woman's advocate had appealed for an urgent hearing, citing her ongoing semester examinations, saying the student's liberty was snatched.

Among first to know: 'Local guardian' Mamata Banerjee visits Tejashwi Yadav's babyFollowing West Bengal Mamata Banerjee's visit, Tejashwi Yadav revealed that she was the baby boy's 'local guardian', adding that she was already aware of the development and had been very supportive of the family.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

How are Harvard students coping with Trump's sudden visa order?A sudden US policy shift targeting international students at Harvard has left many in shock and scrambling for options. With academic dreams and career plans hanging in the balance, students are calling for urgent support and clarity.

Had Rs 20 crore debt, got threats: Relative of Dehradun family who died by suicideHailing from Haryana's Hisar, one of the deceased, Praveen Mittal, had shifted to Panchkula 12 years back. He owned a scrap factory in Himachal Pradesh, which was later seized by the bank due to unpaid loans, according to Praveen's cousin Sandeep Agarwal.

Nation in arrears: Inside Pakistan's never-ending bailout loopWhy does Pakistan keep turning to the IMF for rescue, but never seems to recover? What's trapping its economy in this endless bailout loop? Dive in to find out.

Odisha to go for trademark shield for Jagannath temple amid row with BengalAt the centre of the row is the Mamata Banerjee-led Bengal government's move to name the newly built temple in Digha as 'Jagannath dham'.

Skip classes, lose your visa: US's big warning to Indian, foreign studentsThe United States on Tuesday warned Indian and other foreign students against skipping classes or leaving their programs amid the ongoing mass deportation row, stating that the students might risk losing their visas or may not be able to apply for any future US visa.

In big shake-up, collegium picks 3 judges for Supreme Court, 5 to lead high courtsThe Supreme Court collegium recommended Justice NV Anjaria of the Karnataka High Court, Justice Vijay Bishnoi of the Gauhati High Court, and Justice Atil S Chandurkar of the Bombay High Court for appointment as top court judges.

Why Indian cities get submerged overnight. No, it's not just rainIndian cities get submerged overnight, and that's not just because of heavy rains. A deadly combination of unplanned urban growth and inadequate infrastructure amplifies urban flooding. To make matters worse, climate change–induced shifts in seasonal rainfall patterns have made urban flooding a harsh reality for Indian cities.

Mumbai airport receives bomb threat call, second incident in a weekThis is the second time in a week that Mumbai airport has received a bomb threat. On May 17, police received a threat email warning of explosions at the airport and the Taj Mahal Palace Hotel.

Op Sindoor: New video shows how India hit Pak army posts, sent Rangers fleeingA senior BSF official said the LeT's Looni terror launchpad and the Mastpur launchpad in Pakistan were destroyed on the night of May 9-10 and during the action, Pakistani Rangers were seen fleeing.

Two Karnataka MLAs expelled from BJP for 6 years over 'repeated violations'The BJP has expelled Uttara Kannada MLA A Shivaram Hebbar from the party for six years, citing repeated indiscipline and anti-party activities. Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar hit out at the BJP's selective disciplinary action, calling out the party for ignoring graver allegations against other leaders.

Harvard researcher predicted Kashmir's apple crisis 10 years ago. How he is reviving itTen years ago, he warned of collapse. A research paper Khurram Mir submitted at Harvard had flagged the cracks in Kashmir's apple economy. Today, he is leading a quiet revolution in the orchards. With modern tools, climate-smart farming, and a reimagined supply chain, he's helping thousands of farmers rebuild a shrinking economy.

Frustrated singles forcing China to smuggle wives from Bangladesh, NepalChina's gender imbalance has birthed a shadow industry of bride-trafficking, where poor women from several Asian countries, including Bangladesh, Nepal and Myanmar, are lured with false promises and then "sold" as "wives" to rural Chinese men. These women, desperate for a better life, end up being confined, raped, and forced into childbirth.

Turkish company working on Kanpur metro flees with Rs 80 crore unpaid duesAs per the contractors, all the top officials of this Turkish company have fled Kanpur. When contacted on the phone, they gave evasive answers and avoided the issue.

Delivering dialogues like Paresh Rawal: Congress on PM's reaction to Op SindoorCongress accused Prime Minister Modi of responding to sensitive issues like Operation Sindoor with theatrical and troll-like rhetoric instead of serious leadership.

sports.headline: RCB's top-2 finish extremely important: Dinesh Karthik before LSG showdownIPL 2025: RCB's clash against LSG will decide their playoff path this season, with a win securing a top-two finish and Qualifier 1 spot, while a loss sends them into the Eliminator against the Mumbai Indians.

Gill gets Steve Waugh's backing as Test captain: Indian cricket in good handsIndia's new Test captain Shubman Gill has got the backing of legendary Australia captain Steve Waugh as he's set to make his captaincy debut in the upcoming tour of England.

Shreyas Iyer felt underappreciated at KKR: Robin Uthappa praises PBKS leaderIPL 2025: Robin Uthappa credited Shreyas Iyer's success with Punjab Kings to his natural leadership, stating the skipper was long undervalued at his former franchise KKR, despite guiding them to a title just last season.

Robin Uthappa points out RCB's major flaw heading into the playoffsFormer India cricketer turned commentator Robin Uthappa has highlighted Royal Challengers Bengaluru's major flaw heading into the playoffs of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

BCCI to honour Indian Armed forces during IPL 2025 closing ceremonyThe BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) will be paying a special tribute to the Indian armed forces during the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) closing ceremony, confirmed BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia.

LSG vs RCB, IPL 2025 Preview: Can Bengaluru finish top-2 after 9 years?LSG vs RCB, IPL 2025 Preview: RCB enter their final league match of IPL 2025 with top-two ambitions alive, but face a pride-fuelled LSG in tricky Lucknow conditions. Hazlewood's return and dew factor could heavily influence the outcome.

Jannik Sinner thanks best goalkeeper Donnarumma for attending French Open matchJannik Sinner began his French Open campaign with a straight-sets win over Arthur Rinderknech, extending his Grand Slam streak and acknowledging the presence of PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma in the crowd.

Rishabh Pant is victim of bad timing in IPL 2025: Akash Deep LSG pacer Akash Deep feels that his captain Rishabh Pant, is a victim of "bad timing" in his career, which explains his woeful form this season. He added that it's not so much a case of pressure affecting Pant, as the captain is well accustomed to playing top-flight cricket.

PBKS manifested, believed and worked hard for top two finish: Shashank SinghPunjab Kings' (PBKS) batter Shashank Singh revealed that their team manifested a top two finish right after the auction and worked hard towards it. Punjab qualified for the IPL playoffs after 11 years and guaranteed a top-two finish, following their 7-wicket win over Mumbai Indians (MI) in their last fixture in Jaipur.

Told Priyansh Arya would be the find of IPL 2025, hard to argue now: PontingIPL 2025: Priyansh Arya delivered a match-winning knock against Mumbai Indians, validating Ricky Ponting's early-season prediction of him being a breakout star. The young batter's consistency and composure have been key to Punjab Kings securing a top-two finish in IPL 2025.

PBKS loss not the end of the world, we'll bounce back in Eliminator: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton said that the team isn't too worried about their loss against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their last fixture and backed them to bounce back strongly in the Eliminator. PBKS beat MI by seven wickets in their last league fixture in Jaipur.

Jannik Sinner thanks best goalkeeper Donnarumma for attending French Open matchJannik Sinner began his French Open campaign with a straight-sets win over Arthur Rinderknech, extending his Grand Slam streak and acknowledging the presence of PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma in the crowd.

Rishabh Pant is victim of bad timing in IPL 2025: Akash Deep LSG pacer Akash Deep feels that his captain Rishabh Pant, is a victim of "bad timing" in his career, which explains his woeful form this season. He added that it's not so much a case of pressure affecting Pant, as the captain is well accustomed to playing top-flight cricket.

Punjab qualified for the IPL playoffs after 11 years and guaranteed a top-two finish, following their 7-wicket win over Mumbai Indians (MI) in their last fixture in Jaipur.

The young batter's consistency and composure have been key to Punjab Kings securing a top-two finish in IPL 2025.

PBKS loss not the end of the world, we'll bounce back in Eliminator: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton said that the team isn't too worried about their loss against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their last fixture and backed them to bounce back strongly in the Eliminator. PBKS beat MI by seven wickets in their last league fixture in Jaipur.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
